page.title: 08THE VILLAGE CHURCH-WEBHEATH
page.content: The church was built in May 1869_Feb. 1870. It can hold 200 people in one service and has an organ and a piano. 50-60 people regularly attend services Other events like concerts and meetings take place in the church.One special feature of the church is it's stained glass memorial windows.There have been two Vicars and 18 Priests in charge. The church is a member of the Ridge Ministry which is a group of parishes, Headless Cross, Crabbs Cross St. Georges and Webheath. It enables the clergy to serve the parishes better. The church has a font for baptisms. Weddings have only been held in the church since 1939. There is only a small graveyard attached to the church. No one has been buried there for some years. Coffee,squash and biscuits are served after services in the church. The church has a bell.
